page.title: 15Hampton Parish Church
page.content: {St. Mary & St. Bartholomew}is the {Parish Church}of{Hampton-in-Arden.}It is situated on the highest land in the village by the bend of High Street and Solihull Road. The oldest part of the church is the chancel which was built in about{1130. The{tower}originally had a tall spire but this was destroyed by lightning in 1643. Within the tower are 6 bells which were cast in 1725. The church is about 35metres long and 13metres wide. The church plays an important part in the life of the village. Around 125 people attend for{worship}each{Sunday. There is a small choir, a Sunday School and a creche. About 8 weddings and 10 christenings take place each year. The children of the village school visit the church for services 3 times a year, and the vicar of Hampton visits the school regularly.
